purpose_text.para: Defines the configuration of the current Security state. It specifies:

listitem.content: The Security state of EL0, EL1, and EL2. The Security state is either Secure or Non-secure.
The Execution state at lower Exception levels.
Whether IRQ, FIQ, SError interrupts, and External abort exceptions are taken to EL3.
Whether various operations are trapped to EL3.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Activity Monitors Virtual Offsets Enable.

field_value_description.para: Accesses to AMEVCNTVOFF0<n>_EL2 and AMEVCNTVOFF1<n>_EL2 at EL2 are trapped to EL3. Indirect reads of the virtual offset registers are zero.
Accesses to AMEVCNTVOFF0<n>_EL2 and AMEVCNTVOFF1<n>_EL2 are not affected by this field.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Reserved, RES0.
TWE Delay. A 4-bit unsigned number that, when SCR_EL3.TWEDEn is 1, encodes the minimum delay in taking a trap of WFE caused by SCR_EL3.TWE as 2^(TWEDEL + 8) cycles.
Reserved, RES0.
TWE Delay Enable. Enables a configurable delayed trap of the WFE instruction caused by SCR_EL3.TWE.

field_value_description.para: The delay for taking a WFE trap is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED.
The delay for taking a WFE trap is at least the number of cycles defined in SCR_EL3.TWEDEL.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
ECV Enable. Enables access to the CNTPOFF_EL2 register.

field_value_description.para: EL2 accesses to CNTPOFF_EL2 are trapped to EL3, and the value of CNTPOFF_EL2 is treated as 0 for all purposes other than direct reads or writes to the register from EL3.
EL2 accesses to CNTPOFF_EL2 are not trapped to EL3 by this mechanism.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Enables access to the Fine-Grained Traps registers: HAFGRTR_EL2, HDFGRTR_EL2, HDFGWTR_EL2, HFGRTR_EL2, HFGITR_EL2 and HFGWTR_EL2.

field_value_description.para: EL2 Accesses to HAFGRTR_EL2, HDFGRTR_EL2, HDFGWTR_EL2, HFGRTR_EL2, HFGITR_EL2 and HFGWTR_EL2 registers are trapped to EL3, and those registers behave as if all bits are set to 0.
EL2 Accesses to HAFGRTR_EL2, HDFGRTR_EL2, HDFGWTR_EL2, HFGRTR_EL2, HFGITR_EL2 and HFGWTR_EL2 registers are not trapped to EL3 by this mechanism.

field_description.para: Traps caused by accesses to the fine-grained trap registers are reported using the EC code of 0x18 and its associated ISS.
Reserved, RES0.
Allocation Tag Access. Controls access at EL2, EL1 and EL0 to Allocation Tags.
When access is prevented:

content.para: Instructions which Load or Store data are Unchecked.
Instructions which Load or Store Allocation Tags treat the Allocation Tag as RAZ/WI.
Instructions which insert Logical Address Tags into addresses treat the Allocation Tag used to generate the Logical Address Tag as 0.
Cache maintenance instructions which invalidate Allocation Tags from caches behave as the equivalent Clean and Invalidate operation on Allocation Tags.
MRS and MSR instructions at EL1 and EL2 using GCR_EL1, RGSR_EL1, TFSR_EL1, TFSR_EL2 or TFSRE0_EL1 that are not UNDEFINED or trapped to a lower Exception level are trapped to EL3.
MRS and MSR instructions at EL2 using TFSR_EL12 that are not UNDEFINED are trapped to EL3.

field_value_description.para: Access is prevented.
Access is not prevented.

field_description.para: This field is permitted to be cached in a TLB.
Reserved, RES0.
Enable access to the SCXTNUM_EL2, SCXTNUM_EL1, and SCXTNUM_EL0 registers. The defined values are:

field_value_description.para: EL2, EL1 and EL0 access to SCXTNUM_EL0, EL2 and EL1 access to SCXTNUM_EL1, EL2 access to SCXTNUM_EL2 registers are disabled by this mechanism, causing an exception to EL3, and the values of these registers to be treated as 0.
This control does not cause accesses to SCXTNUM_EL0, SCXTNUM_EL1, SCXTNUM_EL2 to be trapped.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Reserved, RES0.
Fault Injection enable. Trap accesses to the RAS ERX* registers ERXPFGCDN_EL1, ERXPFGCTL_EL1, and ERXPFGF_EL1 from EL1 and EL2 to EL3, reported using EC syndrome value 0x18.

field_value_description.para: Accesses to the specified registers from EL1 and EL2 generate a Trap exception to EL3.
This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.

field_description.para: If EL3 is not implemented, the Effective value of SCR_EL3.FIEN is 0b1.

If ERRIDR_EL1.NUM is zero, meaning no error records are implemented, or no error record accessible using System registers is owned by a node that implements the RAS Common Fault Injection Model Extension, then this bit might be RES0.
Reserved, RES0.
Non-maskable External Aborts. When SCR_EL3.EA == 1, controls whether PSTATE.A masks SError interrupts at EL3.

field_value_description.para: If SCR_EL3.EA == 1, asserted SError interrupts are not taken at EL3 if PSTATE.A == 1.
If SCR_EL3.EA == 1, asserted SError interrupts are taken at EL3 regardless of the value of PSTATE.A.

field_description.para: When SCR_EL3.EA == 0:

listitem.content: Asserted SError interrupts are not taken at EL3 regardless of the value of PSTATE.A and this field.
This field is ignored and its Effective value is 0.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
External aborts to SError interrupt vector.

field_value_description.para: Synchronous External abort exceptions taken to EL3 are taken to the appropriate synchronous exception vector offset from VBAR_EL3.
Synchronous External abort exceptions taken to EL3 are taken to the appropriate SError interrupt vector offset from VBAR_EL3.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Secure EL2 Enable.

field_value_description.para: All behaviors associated with Secure EL2 are disabled. All registers, including timer registers, defined by are UNDEFINED, and those timers are disabled.
All behaviors associated with Secure EL2 are enabled.

field_description.para: When the value of this bit is 1, then:

content.para: When SCR_EL3.NS == 0, the SCR_EL3.RW bit is treated as 1 for all purposes other than reading or writing the register.
If Secure EL1 is using AArch32, then any of the following operations, executed in Secure EL1, is trapped to Secure EL2, using the EC value of ESR_EL2.EC== 0x3 :

listitem.content: A read or write of the SCR.
A read or write of the NSACR.
A read or write of the MVBAR.
A read or write of the SDCR.

content.para: If Secure EL1 is using AArch32, then any of the following operations, executed in Secure EL1, is trapped to Secure EL2 using the EC value of ESR_EL2.EC== 0x0 :

listitem.content: Execution of an SRS instruction that uses R13_mon.
Execution of an MRS (Banked register) or MSR (Banked register) instruction that would access SPSR_mon, R13_mon, or R14_mon.

note.para: If the Effective value of SCR_EL3.EEL2 is 0, then these operations executed in Secure EL1 using AArch32 are trapped to EL3.

field_description.para: In a Secure only implementation that does not implement EL3 but implements EL2, behaves as if SCR_EL3.EEL2 == 1.
This bit is permitted to be cached in a TLB.
Reserved, RES0.
Controls the use of the following instructions related to Pointer Authentication. Traps are reported using EC syndrome value 0x09:

listitem.content: AUTDA, AUTDB, AUTDZA, AUTDZB, AUTIA, AUTIA1716, AUTIASP, AUTIAZ, AUTIB, AUTIB1716, AUTIBSP, AUTIBZ, AUTIZA, AUTIZB, PACDA, PACDB, PACDZA, PACDZB, PACIA, PACIA1716, PACIASP, PACIAZ, PACIB, PACIB1716, PACIBSP, PACIBZ, PACIZA, PACIZB, RETAA, RETAB, BRAA, BRAB, BLRAA, BLRAB, BRAAZ, BRABZ, BLRAAZ, BLRABZ, ERETAA, ERETAB, LDRAA and LDRAB when: In EL0, when HCR_EL2.TGE==0 or HCR_EL2.E2H==0, and the associated SCTLR_EL1.En<N><M> == 1. In EL0, when HCR_EL2.TGE==1 and HCR_EL2.E2H==1, and the associated SCTLR_EL2.En<N><M> == 1. In EL1, when the associated SCTLR_EL1.En<N><M> == 1. In EL2, when the associated SCTLR_EL2.En<N><M> == 1.

field_value_description.para: The use of any instruction related to pointer authentication in any Exception level except EL3 when the instructions are enabled are trapped to EL3 unless they are trapped to EL2 as a result of the HCR_EL2.API bit.
This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.

field_description.para: An instruction is trapped only if Pointer Authentication is enabled for that instruction, for more information, see .

note.para: If is implemented but EL3 is not implemented, the system behaves as if this bit is 1.

field.fields_condition: When ARMv8.4-SecEL2 is implemented and ARMv8.3-PAuth is implemented

field_description.para: Controls the use of instructions related to Pointer Authentication:

listitem.content: AUTDA, AUTDB, AUTDZA, AUTDZB, AUTIA, AUTIA1716, AUTIASP, AUTIAZ, AUTIB, AUTIB1716, AUTIBSP, AUTIBZ, AUTIZA, AUTIZB, PACDA, PACDB, PACDZA, PACDZB, PACIA, PACIA1716, PACIASP, PACIAZ, PACIB, PACIB1716, PACIBSP, PACIBZ, PACIZA, PACIZ, RETAA, RETAB, BRAA, BRAB, BLRAA, BLRAB, BRAAZ, BRABZ, BLRAAZ, BLRABZ, ERETAA, ERETAB, LDRAA and LDRAB when: In Non-secure EL0, when HCR_EL2.TGE==0 or HCR_EL2.E2H==0, and the associated SCTLR_EL1.En<N><M>== 1. In Non-secure EL0, when HCR_EL2.TGE==1 and HCR_EL2.E2H==1, and the associated SCTLR_EL2.En<N><M> == 1. In Secure EL0, when the associated SCTLR_EL2.En<N><M> == 1. In Secure or Non-secure EL1, when the associated SCTLR_EL1.En<N><M> == 1. In EL2, when the associated SCTLR_EL2.En<N><M> == 1.

field_value_description.para: The use of any instruction related to pointer authentication in any Exception level except EL3 when the instructions are enabled are trapped to EL3 unless they are trapped to EL2 as a result of the HCR_EL2.API bit.
This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.

note.para: If is implemented but EL3 is not implemented, the system behaves as if this bit is 1.

field.fields_condition: When ARMv8.4-SecEL2 is not implemented and ARMv8.3-PAuth is implemented

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.

Trap registers holding "key" values for Pointer Authentication. Traps accesses to the following registers, using EC syndrome value 0x18, from EL1 or EL2 to EL3 unless they are trapped to EL2 as a result of the HCR_EL2.APK bit or other traps:

content.para: APIAKeyLo_EL1, APIAKeyHi_EL1, APIBKeyLo_EL1, APIBKeyHi_EL1.
APDAKeyLo_EL1, APDAKeyHi_EL1, APDBKeyLo_EL1, APDBKeyHi_EL1.
APGAKeyLo_EL1, and APGAKeyHi_EL1.

field_value_description.para: Access to the registers holding "key" values for pointer authentication from EL1 or EL2 are trapped to EL3 unless they are trapped to EL2 as a result of the HCR_EL2.APK bit or other traps.
This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.

field_description.para: For more information, see .

note.para: If is implemented but EL3 is not implemented, the system behaves as if this bit is 1.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Trap Error record accesses. Accesses to the RAS ERR and RAS ERX registers from EL1 and EL2 to EL3 are trapped as follows:

content.para: If EL1 is using AArch64, ERRIDR_EL1, ERRSELR_EL1, ERXADDR_EL1, ERXCTLR_EL1, ERXFR_EL1, ERXMISC0_EL1, ERXMISC1_EL1, and ERXSTATUS_EL1, are trapped and reported using EC syndrome value 0x18.
If is implemented, ERXMISC2_EL1, and ERXMISC3_EL1, are trapped and reported using EC syndrome value 0x18.
If EL1 is using AArch32, accesses by MCR or MRC to the following registers are reported using EC syndrome value 0x03, accesses by MCRR or MRRC are reported using EC syndrome value 0x04:

listitem.content: ERRIDR, ERRSELR, ERXADDR, ERXADDR2, ERXCTLR, ERXCTLR2, ERXFR, ERXFR2, ERXMISC0, ERXMISC1, ERXMISC2, ERXMISC3, and ERXSTATUS.

content.para: If ARMv8.4-RAS is implemented, accesses by MCR or MRC to the following registers are reported using EC syndrome value 0x03, accesses by MCRR or MRRC are reported using EC syndrome value 0x04:

field_value_description.para: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
Accesses to the specified registers from EL1 and EL2 generate a Trap exception to EL3.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Trap LOR registers. Traps accesses to the LORSA_EL1, LOREA_EL1, LORN_EL1, LORC_EL1, and LORID_EL1 registers from EL1 and EL2 to EL3, unless the access has been trapped to EL2.

field_value_description.para: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.
EL1 and EL2 accesses to the LOR registers that are not UNDEFINED are trapped to EL3, unless it is trapped HCR_EL2.TLOR.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Traps EL2, EL1, and EL0 execution of WFE instructions to EL3, from both Security states and both Execution states, reported using EC syndrome value 0x01.

field_value_description.para: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.

Any attempt to execute a WFE instruction at any Exception level lower than EL3 is trapped to EL3, if the instruction would otherwise have caused the PE to enter a low-power state and it is not trapped by SCTLR.nTWE, HCR.TWE, SCTLR_EL1.nTWE, SCTLR_EL2.nTWE, or HCR_EL2.TWE.

field_description.para: In AArch32 state, the attempted execution of a conditional WFE instruction is only trapped if the instruction passes its condition code check.

note.para: Since a WFE or WFI can complete at any time, even without a Wakeup event, the traps on WFE of WFI are not guaranteed to be taken, even if the WFE or WFI is executed when there is no Wakeup event. The only guarantee is that if the instruction does not complete in finite time in the absence of a Wakeup event, the trap will be taken.

field_description.para: For more information about when WFE instructions can cause the PE to enter a low-power state, see .
Traps EL2, EL1, and EL0 execution of WFI instructions to EL3, from both Security states and both Execution states, reported using EC syndrome value 0x01.

field_value_description.para: This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.

Any attempt to execute a WFI instruction at any Exception level lower than EL3 is trapped to EL3, if the instruction would otherwise have caused the PE to enter a low-power state and it is not trapped by SCTLR.nTWI, HCR.TWI, SCTLR_EL1.nTWI, SCTLR_EL2.nTWI, or HCR_EL2.TWI.

field_description.para: In AArch32 state, the attempted execution of a conditional WFI instruction is only trapped if the instruction passes its condition code check.

note.para: Since a WFE or WFI can complete at any time, even without a Wakeup event, the traps on WFE of WFI are not guaranteed to be taken, even if the WFE or WFI is executed when there is no Wakeup event. The only guarantee is that if the instruction does not complete in finite time in the absence of a Wakeup event, the trap will be taken.

field_description.para: For more information about when WFI instructions can cause the PE to enter a low-power state, see .
Traps Secure EL1 accesses to the Counter-timer Physical Secure timer registers to EL3, from AArch64 state only, reported using EC syndrome value 0x18.

field_value_description.para: Secure EL1 using AArch64 accesses to the CNTPS_TVAL_EL1, CNTPS_CTL_EL1, and CNTPS_CVAL_EL1 are trapped to EL3 when Secure EL2 is disabled. If Secure EL2 is enabled, the behavior is as if the value of this field was 0b1.
This control does not cause any instructions to be trapped.

note.para: Accesses to the Counter-timer Physical Secure timer registers are always enabled at EL3. These registers are not accessible at EL0.

field_description.para: Execution state control for lower Exception levels.

field_value_description.para: Lower levels are all AArch32.
The next lower level is AArch64.
If EL2 is present:

content.para: EL2 is AArch64.
EL2 controls EL1 and EL0 behaviors.

field_value_description.para: If EL2 is not present:

content.para: EL1 is AArch64.
EL0 is determined by the Execution state described in the current process state when executing at EL0.

field_description.para: If AArch32 state is not supported by the implementation at EL2 and AArch32 state is not supported by the implementation at EL1, then this bit is RAO/WI.
If AArch32 state is supported by the implementation at EL1, SCR_EL3.NS == 1 and AArch32 state is not supported by the implementation at EL2, the Effective value of this bit is 1.
If AArch32 state is supported by the implementation at EL1, is implemented and SCR_EL3.{EEL2, NS} == {1, 0}, the Effective value of this bit is 1.
This bit is permitted to be cached in a TLB.

field.fields_condition: When AArch32 is supported at any Exception level

field_description.para: Reserved, RAO/WI.

Secure instruction fetch. When the PE is in Secure state, this bit disables instruction fetch from memory marked in the first stage of translation as being Non-secure. The possible values for this bit are:

field_value_description.para: Secure state instruction fetches from memory marked in the first stage of translation as being Non-secure are permitted.
Secure state instruction fetches from memory marked in the first stage of translation as being Non-secure are not permitted.

field_description.para: This bit is permitted to be cached in a TLB.
Secure instruction fetch. When the PE is in Secure state, this bit disables instruction fetch from Non-secure memory.

field_value_description.para: Secure state instruction fetches from Non-secure memory are permitted.
Secure state instruction fetches from Non-secure memory are not permitted.

field_description.para: This bit is permitted to be cached in a TLB.

Hypervisor Call instruction enable. Enables HVC instructions at EL3 and, if EL2 is enabled in the current Security state, at EL2 and EL1, in both Execution states, reported using EC syndrome value 0x00.

field_value_description.para: HVC instructions are UNDEFINED.
HVC instructions are enabled at EL3, EL2, and EL1.

note.para: HVC instructions are always UNDEFINED at EL0 and, if Secure EL2 is disabled, at Secure EL1. Any resulting exception is taken from the current Exception level to the current Exception level.

field_description.para: If EL2 is not implemented, this bit is RES0.
Secure Monitor Call disable. Disables SMC instructions at EL1 and above, from both Security states and both Execution states, reported using EC syndrome value 0x00.

field_value_description.para: SMC instructions are enabled at EL3, EL2 and EL1.
SMC instructions are UNDEFINED.

note.para: SMC instructions are always UNDEFINED at EL0. Any resulting exception is taken from the current Exception level to the current Exception level.
If HCR_EL2.TSC or HCR.TSC traps attempted EL1 execution of SMC instructions to EL2, that trap has priority over this disable.

field_description.para: Reserved, RES0.
Reserved, RES1.
External Abort and SError interrupt routing.

field_value_description.para: When executing at Exception levels below EL3, External aborts and SError interrupts are not taken to EL3.
In addition, when executing at EL3:

content.para: SError interrupts are not taken.
External aborts are taken to EL3.

field_value_description.para: When executing at any Exception level, External aborts and SError interrupts are taken to EL3.

field_description.para: For more information, see .
Physical FIQ Routing.

field_value_description.para: When executing at Exception levels below EL3, physical FIQ interrupts are not taken to EL3.
When executing at EL3, physical FIQ interrupts are not taken.
When executing at any Exception level, physical FIQ interrupts are taken to EL3.

field_description.para: For more information, see .
Physical IRQ Routing.

field_value_description.para: When executing at Exception levels below EL3, physical IRQ interrupts are not taken to EL3.
When executing at EL3, physical IRQ interrupts are not taken.
When executing at any Exception level, physical IRQ interrupts are taken to EL3.

field_description.para: For more information, see .
Non-secure bit.

field_value_description.para: Indicates that EL0 and EL1 are in Secure state.
Indicates that Exception levels lower than EL3 are in Non-secure state, and so memory accesses from those Exception levels cannot access Secure memory.

field_description.para: When SCR_EL3.{EEL2, NS} == {1, 0}, then EL2 is using AArch64 and in Secure state.
